tuv.seg: Responsibility for enforcing the law relating to illegal parking and stopping of motor vehicles rests with traffic wardens and an Garda Síochána
Luíonn an fhreagracht as forfheidhmiú an dlí mar a bhaineann sé le páirceáil mhídhleathach agus le stopadh mótarfheithiclí le Maoir Thráchta agus leis an nGarda Síochána
Illegal parking and stopping of vehicles on public roads are considered traffic offences
Meastar an pháirceáil mhídhleathach agus stopadh feithiclí ar bhóithre poiblí a bheith ina gcionta tráchta
Together with an Garda Síochána, traffic wardens are empowered to issue fixed-charge fines for these offences
Bíonn an chumhacht ag maoir thráchta i dteannta leis an nGarda Síochána le socraithe-mhuirear fíneáil a ghearradh ar na cionta sin
Local authorities employ traffic wardens to monitor instances of these offences in their areas
Fostaíonn údaráis áitiúila maoir thráchta chun monatóireacht a dhéanamh ar chásanna de na cionta sin ina gceantar
The principal legislation governing this area is the Local Authorities (Traffic Wardens) Act 1975 as amended
Is í an phríomhreachtaíocht a rialaíonn an réimse seo ná an tAcht um Údaráis Áitiúla (Maoir Thráchta) 1975 mar atá leasaithe

The offences for which traffic wardens can issue fixed-charge fines are parking and motor tax disk offences, and are set out in the Local Authorities (Traffic Wardens) Act 1975 (Fixed Charge Offences) Regulations 2006 (SI 136/2006)

Is féidir le maoir thráchta a eisiúint fíneálacha socraithe-mhuirear i leith cionta páirceála agus mótarcháin diosca, agus tá na cionta seo leagtha amach sna Rialacháin (Cionta Muirear Seasta) 2006 (IR 136/2006)
In situations where a traffic warden has reasonable grounds for believing someone is committing or has committed an offence, they may deliver a fixed-charge notice on a prescribed form

Má bhíonn cúis réasúnach ag maor tráchta le creidiúint go bhfuil duine éigin i mbun ciona, nó tar éis ciona a dhéanamh, is féidir leis nó léi socraithe-mhuirear fógra a sheachadadh ar fhoirm fhorordaithe
This form is commonly known as a "parking ticket"
Tugtar "ticéad páirceála" ar an bhfoirm sin sa ghnáthchaint
This form will state that you have committed an offence and will state the date, time and location of the offence and will detail your vehicle registration
Déarfaidh an fhoirm seo go bhfuil cion déanta agat agus beidh dáta, am, agus áit an chiona chomh maith le sonraí do clárú feithicle
Most traffic wardens use a hand-held computerised device to issue tickets and the local authority keeps a record of all tickets issued in a main database

Baineann an chuid is mó de na maoir thráchta úsáid as gaireas láimhe ríomhaireachta chun ticéid a eisiúint agus coinníonn an t-údarás áitiúil taifead de na ticéid ar fad a eisítear ar bhunachar sonraí lárnach
Using this database, the local authority can find out how many parking fines a particular individual has accumulated
Is féidir leis an údarás áitiúil úsáid a bhaint as an mbunachar sonraí sin chun líon na bhfineálacha páirceála atá carntha ag duine ar leith a aimsiú
Parking is restricted in certain place
Tá cosc ar pháirceáil in áiteanna áirithe
For example, in certain towns and cities, the local authorities have the power to restrict parking at certain times and in certain places
Mar shampla, bíonn an cumhacht ag údaráis áitiúla i mbailte agus i gcathracha áirithe cosc a chur ar pháirceáil ag amanna ar leith agus in áiteanna ar leith
These parking restrictions are clearly indicated through signs clearly displayed at the roadside
Bíonn na srianta páirceála seo taispeánta go soiléir ar fhógraí ag colbha an bhóthair
You can read more about parking fines and restrictions here
Is féidir leat tuilleadh a léamh faoi fíneálacha agus srianta páirceála anseo
A system of fixed-charge fines for illegal parking and non-payment of parking fees is in place
Tá córas socraithe-mhuirear fíneáil i bhfeidhm don pháirceáil mhídhleathach agus do neamh-íoc na dtáillí páirceála
Both traffic wardens and members of the Gardaí issue fines
Eisíonn maoir thráchta agus baill den Gharda Síochána araon fíneálacha

The parking ticket will contain the following details: a reference number, the location of the offence, the registration number of the car, the amount of the fine and the date and time the ticket was issued
Beidh na sonraí seo a leanas ar an ticéad páirceála: uimhir thagartha, áit an chiona, uimhir chláraithe an chairr, méid na fíneála agus an dáta agus an t-am ar ar eisíodh an ticéad
If you have been given a parking ticket or notified by a traffic warden of an offence, you have 28 days commencing on the beginning of the date of the notice to pay the fine
Má thug maor tráchta ticéad páirceála nó fógra faoi chion duit, bíonn 28 lá agat a thosaíonn ag tús dháta an fhógra chun an fhíneáil a íoc
If it is not paid within 28 days, the fine is increased by 50% and if it is still unpaid after a further 28 days then court proceedings are initiated
Mura n-íoctar é laistigh de 28 lá, méadaítear an fineáil faoi 50% agus mura n-íoctar ina dhiaidh sin é tar éis 28 lá sa bhreis air sin, cuirtear tús le himeachtaí cúirte
It is an offence to remove or interfere with a parking ticket that has been placed on the vehicle of another person
Is cion é a chur isteach ar thicéad páirceála a cuireadh ar fheithicil duine eile nó é a bhaint de
If you do so, you could be liable to a fine
Má dhéanann tú amhlaidh, d’fhéadfá a bheith faoi dhliteanas um fhíneáil
Anyone obstructing a traffic warden acting in the course of their duty is guilty of an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine
Má chuireann éinne bac ar mhaor tráchta agus é nó í i mbun a gcuid oibre bíonn an té sin ciontach i gcoir agus faoi dhliteanas d’fhíneáil ar chiontú go hachomhair iad
Traffic wardens can request or demand your name and address
Féadann maoir thráchta d’ainm agus do sheoladh a iarraidh nó a éileamh
They are obliged to carry identification with them and to identify themselves as traffic wardens
Caithfidh siad aitheantas a thabhairt leo agus iad féin a chur in aithne mar mhaoir thráchta
Failure to give your name and address on demand is also an offence and you may be liable on a summary conviction to a fine
Is cion é má mhainnítear chun ainm agus seoladh a thabhairt nuair a éilítear iad agus d’fhéadfá a bheith faoi dhliteanas fíneáil ar chiontú go hachomhair iad
Fixed charge fines for parking offences can range from €40 to €80, depending on the nature of the offence
Gearrtar fíneálacha socraithe-mhuirear idir €40 agus €80, ag brath ar an gcion féin
